title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 850.1 - General provisions and definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 850.1 - General provisions and definitions

State Regulations
(a) The Practice Rules of the Appellate Division. The Practice Rules of the Appellate Division are
embodied in Part 1250 of the New York Rules of Court (Part 1250 of this Title)
and the Electronic Filing Rules of the Appellate Division are embodied in Part
1245 (Part 1245 of this Title). The Rules of Practice of the Appellate

Division, Third Judicial Department are intended to supplement the Practice

Rules of the Appellate Division. Where there is a conflict between this Part
and Parts 1250 and 1245 of this Title, this Part controls when practicing
within the Third Judicial Department. (b) Definitions. All of the definitions contained in section
1250.1
of this Title are
incorporated herein unless otherwise indicated. (c) Court sessions. Unless otherwise directed by the court, court
sessions shall commence at 1:00 p.m., except on Friday and the last session day
of a term, when they shall commence at 9:30 a.m. A term of court shall be
deemed to continue until the day on which the next term convenes, and the court
may reconvene at any time during recess. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
850.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
